channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Blocked Drain, 23rd January
item.description:
Blocked drain that causes flooding after rainfall at the pedestrian crossing making it difficult to cross the road safely.

item.title: 10 inch pothole, 23rd January
item.description:
My left hand tyre went bang on a deep pothole with no lines drawn around it, 20 meters before the golf course and I was heading towards Churchdown
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No double yellow lines at junction, 23rd January
item.description:
There are no double yellow lines on the Bafford Apotoach side at this busy junction. This leads to tradesman and visitors parking on the road and obscuring the view of traffic turning onto Bafford Aporoach. This creates a danger for pedestrians crossing on Bafford Approach.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Bafford Approach, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Bafford Approach, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham

item.title: Led street light not working, 23rd January
item.description:
Web Reference: 5426123 Enquiry Number: 22037812 Issue: SL-Street Light Outage Report Location: Streetlight to the right of the briarfield motel and touring park out. Site: GLOUCESTER ROAD I was told it was fixed but it is still not working Coming out of briarfields main gates it's the first street lamp to the left. Next to the left hand gb flag pole
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole in road by prince wales stadium, 23rd January
item.description:
Pothole in road on the side of the prince wales stadium , its been here for few weeks and its getting bigger .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tommy Taylors Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Multpilemtree roots breaking though tarmac, 23rd January
item.description:
Multiple tree roots breaking through the tarmac all the way along the cycle path. One near the pin dropped is particularly bad. Cyclists are either bouncing off the mound towards pedestrians or swerving onto the footpath to avoid it. I have broken a spine and nearly crashed into a pedestrian due to the dangerous condition of the cycleway. I suggest you have someone actually try and ride a bike on it to see.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lansdown Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: General road marking and stud issues problem, 23rd January
item.description:
Hello, Our road was resurfaced last year, thank you very much. As a result the white lines outside our property, which we paid for, were painted over. I assumed that, at some point, they would be painted back but they haven’t. Some other’s in the road have been done but not ours. The address is [see contact details] Please can we arrange for the lines to be redone. Thank you. Kind regards,
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Large branch cracked which spans over road, 23rd January
item.description:
Tree on left hand side (travelling towards Stroud from birdlip) about 70yds or so before right hand turn onto buckholt road, has large branch which spans above the road. Branch is dropped lower since storm on Sunday night 21/1/24 and appears to be cracked / damaged where it joins main trunk. Could block road or cause damage if falls further.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
